title: Zócalo Square
address: Plaza de la Constitución, Historic Center
description: The city's central plaza, hosting cultural events, protests, and stunning colonial architecture.

title: Chapultepec Park
address: Bosque de Chapultepec I Secc, Miguel Hidalgo, CDMX
description: One of the largest urban parks in the world, featuring museums, lakes, and green spaces.

title: National Museum of Anthropology
address: Av. Paseo de la Reforma & Gandhi, Polanco
description: Showcases Mexico’s pre-Hispanic cultures with iconic artifacts like the Aztec Sun Stone.

title: Mercado Roma
description: Trendy gourmet food market with local chefs offering tacos, desserts, craft beer, and more.

title: Torre Latinoamericana Viewpoint
description: Panoramic views of the city from one of its most iconic skyscrapers.

title: Teotihuacán Pyramids
address: San Juan Teotihuacán, Estado de México
description: Ancient Mesoamerican city with the Pyramid of the Sun and Moon; explore on foot or with a guide.

title: Trajineras Xochimilco
description: Colorful boat rides along ancient canals with music, snacks, and traditional celebrations.

title: Museo Soumaya
address: Blvd. Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra 303, Granada, CDMX
description: Modern art museum housing works by Rodin, Dalí, and more in a futuristic silver building.
